unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Choosing Tickets with Replacement
question_text:
A charity group decided to hold a raffle with $1{,}000\text{ tickets}$ in a large bin. Of the $1{,}000\text{ tickets}$, $150$ are winners.
If tickets are chosen with replacement, what is the probability a winner will be chosen by the fourth trial?
solution:
Since the winners are chosen with replacement, there is a 15% probability of success on any trial. The probability a winner is drawn by the fourth trial (meaning within four trials) is the sum of the probability that the winner is drawn on the first trial, plus the respective probabilities that the winner is drawn on the second, third, and fourth trials.

P(first trial) =0.15
P(second trial) =0.85⋅0.15
P(third trial) =0.85⋅0.85⋅0.15
P(fourth trial) =0.85⋅0.85⋅0.85⋅0.15

The sum of these numbers is 0.478.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'B'.
